description: Koreans are a versatile civilization that excels in both land and water maps.
dark_age: Start with 4 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses, a lumber camp near forests, and a mining camp near gold.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Assign 5-6 villagers to food, 3-4 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 1-2 to stone.
Build a dock near fish and train fishing ships.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 22-23 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, 150-200 gold, and 50-100 stone at the end of the Dark Age.
feudal_age: Build additional fishing ships and continue fishing for food.
Build a barracks and train infantry units.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade units and sell excess resources for gold.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 200-300 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, 3-4 to stone.
castle_age: Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Build a university and research Masonry and Architecture for improved building strength.
Build a siege workshop and train siege units.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 36-37 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 1200-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, 15-20 to stone.
imperial_age: Train war wagons and research Shinkichon for improved onager performance.
Use siege units to destroy enemy buildings and defenses.
Research the unique technology, Panokseon, for improved naval transport and warship speed.
Have around 6000-7000 food, 4000-5000 wood, 2500-3000 gold, and 3000-4000 stone in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, 30-40 to stone.
